Demonstrates how to show a Street View panorama and map. Street View Panorama and Map Map Access to the location service is required to demonstrate the 'my location' feature, which shows your current location on the map. This sample requires location permission to enable the 'my location' layer. Please try again and grant access to use the location. If the permission has been permanently denied, it can be enabled from the System Settings > Apps > 'Google Maps API Demos'. Location permission is required for this demo. Error code: %1$s The call is not secure; RTP handshake timeout: %s The call encryption has ended: %1$s Authenticate buddy Automatically initiate private messaging Enable private messaging Require private messaging Reset CRYPTO Authenticated CRYPTO Finished CRYPTO Non-Authenticated End private conversation OTR Authenticated OTR Ended OTR Handshake OTR Non-Authenticated Plain Text OTR Handshake_TimeOut Encrypt chats with OTR Refresh private conversation Start private conversation Secure chat What's this Authenticating a buddy helps to ensure that the person you are talking to is who he or she claims to be. To verify the fingerprint, contact your buddy via some other authenticated channel, such as the telephone or GPG-signed email. Each of you should tell your fingerprint to the other. If everything matches up, you should indicate in the following dialog that *I have* verified the fingerprint. Cancel Please enter the fingerprint you received from %1$s. Help I have I have not My Fingerprint for %1$s: %2$s Remote fingerprint for %1$s: %2$s Authenticate Buddy verified that this is in fact the correct fingerprint for %1$s. However your software does not support Off-The-Record messaging. For more information see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Off-the-Record_Messaging %1$s is NOT recording this conversation. You can activate chat history here. %1$s is recording this conversation on your device. You can turn off chat history here. SSL/DNSSEC/DANE Security DNS Configure DNS settings DNS Security (DNSSEC) Domain State change failed Change of the DNSSEC enabled state has failed. Behavior Note that enabling or disabling DNSSEC disables the parallel resolver and will only take effect the next time you start aTalk. Backup resolver Treat all domain names as absolute Enable DNSSEC resolver Default behavior Custom name servers Multiple servers can be delimited with a comma, e.g. 149.20.64.20, 149.20.64.21 (OARC's Open DNSSEC Validating Resolver) DNSSEC failure DNS answer for %1$s is insecure. DNS answer for %1$s is insecure. Reason: %2$s Show advanced options DNSSEC signed zone %1$s returned invalid data.
%2$s %1$s query for %2$s is unsigned.
%1$s has tried to connect to the server at %2$s<, which is a domain that carries a strong protection called DNSSEC. The information that %1$s has obtained from the DNS server is not in accordance with the information DNSSEC provides about this domain.

This should not happen unless very serious mistakes were made at %2$s. It therefore is a very strong indication that something is seriously wrong with the trustworthiness of your network connection.

If you are on someone else's internet connection (like a WiFi hotspot) or if there are special circumstances that make you distrust your regular internet provider, we strongly advise you to stop using it immediately and look for an alternative internet access point. When you are safely connected to another network, the problem should be resolved automatically. If this is not the case, contact your service provider to inform them about the issue.
